Name: Student Solutions Manual, Volume 2 for Serway/Jewett's Physics for Scientists and Engineers, 8th

ReviewList.Text: im a physics student and this book really helps. definitely recommend it. or going on cramster.com. but cramster didnt have the solutions for 8th edition, so back to the original point - its good stuff.

You do not get the solutions for all the odd numbered problems, just select problems from the book.  Instead of just showing the steps to solve it, it gives you the sections of Conceptualize, Categorize, Analyze and Finalize. Just the Analyze portion would be enough for a solutions manual and would be better if they included this for every odd problem. Granted there is value in the other portions but generally when working out a problem that you are stuck on, just seeing the steps to the solution is enough. I always buy the solutions manuals for my classes but this, like the textbook, is lacking compared to other books/classes. It may just be the publisher, Brooks/Cole Cengage, I find Pearson/Prentice Hall and McGraw Hill to be better publishers.

Daughter needed text book for college course and this was viable alternative-came from India of all places and actually got here well before scheduled delivery date. added plus it was identical to book required for course at nice discount form what the bookstore wanted!
This is a good book, I said good because it does not have all the answers. Overall its good to have i because it help you to understand the material
It only has certain answers and a lot of them are the easy ones. It's not worth it. I thought it had every solution.
It goes through all the key ideas and mostly helps you understand the how's and why's. A great buy indeed.
